info.description:
The FEMA Flood Map API offers up-to-date FEMA flood zone maps and data that can be easily embedded into partners' products or workflow. Our data service is used by insurance companies, appraisers, real estate investors and software companies that offer services to these industries.

We offer the data in the various formats described below to meet a variety of partner use cases. If you have a particular need that you don't see met by the services below, please contact us and we'll likely be able to add what you need.

# Authentication

Queries to the v3 API require a key provided by National Flood Data, and the key must be provided in a request header using the key "X-API-KEY". The key cannot be supplied as a parameter, and therefore the API cannot be accessed through a simple web browser.
To obtain a key, [log-in or register](https://www.nationalflooddata.com/log-in.html)

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

# Rate Limiting

 The v3 API implements a rate limit of four requests per second with a burst limit of three, i.e. at most three requests will be processed simultaneously.

# Flood Zones

The core of the FEMA flood maps API is the "flood zone" that is assigned to each region. This value is returned as the `fld_zone` field from the `s_fld_haz_ar` layer. Definitions for the zones are below.

| Flood Zone | Description |
|---|---|
| A | An area with a 1% annual chance of flood; does not have base flood elevations (BFEs) available. |
| AE | An area with a 1% annual chance of flood; base flood elevations BFEs are available. |
| AH | An area with a 1% annual chance of flood with flood depths ranging from 1 to 3 feet, generally near pond or pooling areas. BFEs are available. |
| AO | An area with a 1% annual chance of flood with flood depths ranging from 1 to 3 feet, generally sheet flow on sloping terrain. BFEs are available. |
| AR | An area inundated by flooding, for which BFEs or average depths have been determined. This is an area that was previously, and will again, be protected from the 1% annual chance flood by a Federal flood protection system whose restoration is Federally funded and underway |
| A1-A30 | An area with a 1% annual chance flooding, for which BFEs have been determined. |
| B, X500 | An area with at least a 0.2% chance of annual flood or with a 1% annual chance of flood with average depths less that one foot or with drainage area less than one square mile. (C is the older designation and X500 is the current designation.) |
| C, X | An area outside the 0.2% and 1% annual chance of flood regions. (C is the older designation and X500 is the current designation.) |
| D | An area where flooding is possible but has not been studied. |
| V | An area with a 1% annual chance flooding with velocity hazard due to waves; BFEs have are not available. |
| VE, V1-V30 | An area with a 1% annual chance flooding with velocity hazard due to waves; BFEs have are available. |

# Base Flood Elevations

## bfe_type

The API field `bfe_type` describes how the base flood elevation for a region was determined.

| bfe_type | description |
| -- | -- |
| provided | The base flood elevation is provided by FEMA within the flood zone layer. |
| matched | The base flood elevation is provided by FEMA in an additional later, and that layer only has one base flood elevation transect that intersects the flood zone polygon. |
| interpolated | The base flood elevation is provided by FEMA in an additional later. More than one base flood elevation transect intersects the flood zone polygon, and the closest value of these is used. |
| extrapolated | No base flood elevation is provided by FEMA for the flood zone polygon. A value is extrapolated from neighboring values. |

## Bodies of Water

The API returns the distance to nearest ten bodies of water. The bodies of water considered are those provided in the USGS National Hydrological Data (NHD) Set with an area greater than 0.25 square kilometers. Streams and not included. The USGS also generally does not include reservoirs, and therefore distance to these are not included.

| Key | Description |
| --- | --- |
| areasqkm | area of the polygon in square meters (a body of water may be made of multiple polygons) |
| distkm | distance to the body of water in kilometers |
| filename | name of the file from USGS containing the body of water |
| gnis_id | unique identifier provided by USGS |
| name | name of body of water, generally only available for larger bodies of water |
| state | US state that the body of water is in |

## Elevation

Elevation in feet. Data provided by USGS. Defaults to -1000000 when not available.
info.title: FEMA Flood Map API

tags.name: Flood API
tags.description: Description of our standard data APIs

tags.name: Flood Map Raw
tags.description: Provides exhaustive flood map data within a determined by user

tags.name: Dynamic Map
tags.description: How to use the dynamic flood map, i.e. zoom in and out, etc.

tags.name: Map Tiles
tags.description: Map tiles as used in the dynamic and static maps.

tags.name: Static Map
tags.description: How to use the static flood map, i.e. to obtain map images in jpg format to embed, for example, in a user report.

500.description: Something happened behind the scenes at National Flood Data

example.message: Internal Server Error. Try again later.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: category of storm surge for which to retrieve tiles

500.description: Something happened behind the scenes at National Flood Data

example.message: Internal Server Error. Try again later.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: address with street number, street type, city, state, zip and without punctuation. _Required_ for searchtypes `addresscoord` and `addressparcel`. Do not include 4 digit zipcode extension.

parameters.name: polygon
parameters.description: Polygon in well known text format

parameters.name: elevation
parameters.description: Include Elevation Data (Elevation, BFE, Stormsurge) (_Special key required_)

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: Include property data (Only for seachtype addressparcel) (_Special key required_)

400.description: Invalid request caused by bad or missing parameters

500.description: Something happened behind the scenes at National Flood Data

example.message: Internal Server Error. Try again later.

x-codeSamples.source:
headers = {'x-api-key':'YOUR KEY'}

# Get data without BFE
payload = {
  'lat': 34.071783,
  'lng': -118.2596,
  'searchtype':'addresscoord',
  'loma': False
}
r = requests.get('https://api.nationalflooddata.com/v3/data', headers=headers, params=payload)

 # Get data with BFE
payload = {
  'address':'430 Australian Ave Palm Beach, FL 33480',
  'searchtype':'addressparcel',
  'loma': False
  'elevation': True
}
r = requests.get('https://api.nationalflooddata.com/v3/data', headers=headers, params=payload)

post.summary: FEMA Flood Data query - batch. Allows for posting a set of data requests, which are processed asynchronously. Poll the url given in the `result` field of response; this will return 200 and a set of results when the batch is completed. A batch may contain up to 20,000 requests.

id.description: User provided id. Must be unique

address.description: address with street number, street type, city, state, zip and without punctuation. _Required_ for searchtypes `addresscoord` and `addressparcel`. Do not include 4 digit zipcode extension.

polygon.description: Polygon in well known text format

elevation.description: Include Elevation Data (Elevation, BFE, Stormsurge) (_Special key required_)

property.description: Include property data (Only for seachtype addressparcel) (_Special key required_)

400.description: Invalid request caused by bad or missing parameters

500.description: Something happened behind the scenes at National Flood Data

example.message: Internal Server Error. Try again later.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: degree value for size of square that polygons are returned for

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: When set to false, geojson content will not be included. The geojson content can be large, so not including it is often faster.

parameters.name: excludex
parameters.description: When set to true, polygons with flood zone (fld_zone) "X" will not be included in the query. This generally makes the response load much smaller and easier to process quickly.

parameters.name: elevation
parameters.description: When set to true, base flood elevations (BFE) will be included in geojson format.

400.description: Invalid request caused by bad or missing parameters

500.description: Something happened behind the scenes at National Flood Data

example.message: Internal Server Error. Try again later.

get.summary: The map provided is dynamic, i.e. the user may zoom and pan within a small range.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: integer parameter between 6 (low zoom) and 17 (high zoom).

parameters.name: showLegend
parameters.description: true to show the legend; any other value false.

get.summary: The static map returns a png image with a marker at the latitude and longitude provided.

parameters.name: showMarker
parameters.description: if marker is set to false, no marker will be shown

parameters.name: showLegend
parameters.description: if legend is set to false, no legend will be shown

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: integer parameter between 14 (low zoom) and 16 (high zoom)

result.description: Presigned url for S3 object containing batch result. The schema for the object at this url is an array of types as for flood data.

match_type.description: The type of match - may differ from search type if e.g. no parcel is found for an `addressparcel` the system will default to `addresscoord`.

census_block.description: census tract number (State id + county id + census tract + block group number)

regemer_sanction.description: Date of regemer sanction. Returned as unformatted text.

tribal.description: Whether or not the community is identified as Tribal in the NFIP Community Status Book

comm_part.description: Community participation. See the [NFIP Community Status Book](https://www.fema.gov/national-flood-insurance-program-community-status-book)

fhbm.description: Date of first flood hazard boundary map. Returned as unformatted text.

curreff.description: Date current firm became effective. Returned as unformatted text. Can be several weeks into the future, in which case (>) follows the date. The date may also be followed by (M) for "No elevation determined", (S) for "Suspended Community" or (E) for "Indicates Entry in Emergency Program"notes

FemaResult.description: The FEMA Flood Data API returns data from interstections of the parcel with feature layers of FEMA shapefiles, as well as the community participation status and the census tract number.

coastline.description: list of nearest coastline, if any; one dictionary per intersection.

waterbody.description: list of nearest bodies of water, if any; one dictionary per intersection.

yearbuilt.description: year the property queried was built

propertyusedescription.example: Multi Family: Multi-family Dwellings (Generic, Any Combination)

StormSurgeResult.description: estimated flood water in the event of a storm

1.description: estimated flood water in the event of a category 1 storm

2.description: estimated flood water in the event of a category 2 storm

3.description: estimated flood water in the event of a category 3 storm

4.description: estimated flood water in the event of a category 4 storm

5.description: estimated flood water in the event of a category 5 storm

zone_subty.description: text description of zone, available occasionally

projectnam.example: THE PAINESVILLE INDUSTRIAL PARK SUBDIVISION, SUBLOT 12 -- 440 WEST PROSPECT STREET

firm_pan.description: NFIP Map Number of Community-Panel Number onb a Standard Flood Hazard Determination Form

pol_name1.description: municipal name, e.g. city or county

Geocode.description: National Flood Data uses the MapBox geocoder, and the geocode fields are those returned by MapBox

relevance.description: the quality of the match on a range from 0 to 1.

matchLevel.description: the level at which the match was made

label.example: 521 Saguaro Dr, Fort Worth, TX 76177, United States

distkm.description: shortest distance from query point to line in km
shortest distance from query point to polygon in km
